index.current_version: Welcome to WISP Panel! You are currently running on version {version}.

general.company_name_footer: This is the name that is used throughout the panel and in emails sent to clients.
general.random_database_deployment_footer: If this is enabled, all game servers can deploy their databases on any database host instead of just the assigned one for the node.
general.require_2fa_footer: If enabled, any account falling into the selected grouping will be required to have 2-Factor authentication enabled to use the Panel.
general.default_language_footer: The default language to use when rendering UI components.

embed.site_name_footer: The site name that should be displayed on embeds.
embed.title_footer: The title that should be displayed on embeds.
embed.description_footer: Short description that should be displayed on embeds.
embed.image_footer: The Image URL that will be displayed on embeds.

js_injector.title: JavaScript Injector
js_injector.minification_notice: The JS may get minified to have fast loading speeds for everyone. Keep a local copy of your JS if you plan to edit it in the future.

css_injector.title: CSS Injector
css_injector.minification_notice: The CSS may get minified to have fast loading speeds for everyone. Keep a local copy of your CSS if you plan to edit it in the future.

whmcs.whmcs_notice: Please look at the guide on how to gather the credentials required to configure WHMCS SSO for your panel: https://www.notion.so/WHMCS-SSO-22cf66a587514dc8a5a287d1f2a8f230
whmcs.sso_enabled_footer: Enables the WHMCS Single-Sign-On integration, allowing users to login to your WISP Panel with their WHMCS account. Required for all other fields to be configured
whmcs.button_text_footer: The login button text that is shown on the login page.
whmcs.url_footer: The URL your whmcs installation is available at. e.g. https://mywhmcs.com/
whmcs.client_id_footer: The WHMCS SSO API Client ID

settings.refresh_page_to_apply_changes: For now, you will have to refresh the website for the custom changes to apply.

migrator.notice: Migrate your data from another Pterodactyl/WISP instance before installing the daemon. If you are migrating more than 100 nests, 100 eggs per nest, 2500 users or 1000 servers contact us for a manual migration, which will also migrate hashed user passwords and database passwords.
migrator.notified_users: All users will receive an email soon. You will be notified when it's finished.
migrator.panel_url_footer: This is the url to the panel from which you want to migrate data. For 0.7.x, the panel should be running v0.7.16 or newer. For 1.x, the panel should be running v1.1.2 or newer. Otherwise, this migrator will not work.
migrator.api_key_footer: This is required to get the panel's information for the migration. The key should have permissions to anything you want to migrate.
migrator.locations_node_and_game_data: Locations, Node, Allocations, Databases and Game Server Data
migrator.locations_node_and_game_data_footer: This will move all game servers with the nodes and their locations. NOTE: This requires all of the options below enabled, and database hosts won't have password configured.
migrator.nests_and_eggs_footer: This will move all nests and eggs overwriting existing ones if they overlap.
migrator.users_footer: This will move all active users with access to at least one server. Passwords won't be automatically migrated (unless you manually contact us) and will require resending account creation email to each user.
migrator.after_migration: After migration is done, please note the following:
migrator.db_hosts_reset: All database hosts' passwords need to be set again (as those can't be synced due to Pterodactyl API limitations)
migrator.migrated_nodes_cpu: Migrated nodes' CPU is set to 800% (with 100% overallocation)
migrator.spare_allocations_ignored: Any spare allocations from migrated nodes were ignored during the migration
migrator.move_to_installing_daemon: Then you can move to setting up the WISP Daemon on your game nodes.

announcements.title: Announcements
announcements.delete_notice: Deleting this announcement is irreversible - please click delete again to confirm the deletion.
announcements.enabled_footer: Whether the announcement is instantly visible to all users.
announcements.announcement_resent: The announcement has been successfully resent to users on the panel.
announcements.cant_resend_disabled: A disabled announcement can't be resent - enable the announcement first.

database_hosts.title: Database Hosts
database_hosts.delete_notice: Are you sure that you want to delete the {name} database host? There is no going back, all data will immediately be removed.
database_hosts.host_has_databases: Cannot delete a database host server that has active databases linked to it.
database_hosts.name_footer: A short identifier used to distinguish this location from others. Must be between 1 and 60 characters, for example, us.nyc.lvl3.
database_hosts.host_footer: The IP address or FQDN that should be used when attempting to connect to this MySQL host from the panel to add new databases.
database_hosts.port_footer: The port that MySQL is running on for this host.
database_hosts.username_footer: The username of an account that has enough permissions to create new users and databases on the system.
database_hosts.password_footer: The password to the account defined.
database_hosts.phpmyadmin_footer: Whether the database host has PHPMyAdmin installed on it. This will enable a button to easily navigate to PHPMyAdmin in the client UI.
database_hosts.display_fqdn_footer: The Display FQDN that should be used instead of the host IP when redirecting user to PhpMyAdmin.
database_hosts.node_footer: Servers on the node which is selected will be able to choose this host as an option when creating a database

application_api.title: Application API Credentials
application_api.delete_notice: Please confirm you want to delete the "{name}" application API key by repeating the name in the input below. This is an irreversible action which can not be undone.

locations.title: Locations
locations.delete_notice: Are you sure that you want to delete the "{short}" location? There is no going back, all data will immediately be removed.
locations.location_has_nodes: You must delete/move all nodes within the location before deleting it.
locations.short_footer: A short identifier used to distinguish this location from others. Must be between 1 and 60 characters, for example, "us.nyc.lvl3".
locations.long_footer: A longer description of this location. Must be less than 255 characters.

nodes.title: Nodes
nodes.not_alive: Error connecting to node! Check browser console for more details.
nodes.cant_delete_attached_servers: You must delete all servers on this node before deleting it.
nodes.delete_notice: Are you sure that you want to delete the "{name}" node? Deleting a node is an irreversible action and will immediately remove this node from the panel.

settings.display_fqdn_footer: Please enter the domain name (e.g node.example.com) that will be shown for users instead of *.daemon.panel.gg. If you're using a domain, you're also gonna need to setup the DNS record for it to point at the node or this won't work as expected.
settings.automatic_allocation_footer: Allows this node to be used when automatically picking a suitable node for server deployment using the API.
settings.behind_proxy_footer: If you are running the daemon behind a proxy such as Cloudflare, select this to have the daemon skip looking for certificates on boot.
settings.maintenance_mode_footer: If the node is marked as 'Under Maintenance' users won't be able to access servers that are on this node.
settings.cpu_footer: Enter the total amount of cpu available on this node for server allocation. You may also provide a percentage that will determine the amount of cpu over the set limit to allow. 1 core = 100%.
settings.memory_footer: Enter the total amount of memory available on this node for allocation to servers. You may also provide a percentage that can allow allocation of more than the defined memory.
settings.disk_footer: Enter the total amount of disk space available on this node for server allocation. You may also provide a percentage that will determine the amount of disk space over the set limit to allow.
settings.max_web_upload_footer: Enter the maximum size of files that can be uploaded through the web-based file manager.

allocations.title: Node Allocations
allocations.cant_delete_in_use: You can't delete an allocation which is attached to a server.
allocations.too_many_ports: Adding more than 1000 ports in a single range at once is not supported.
allocations.invalid_mapping: The mapping provided for port {port} was invalid and could not be processed.
allocations.cidr_out_of_range: CIDR notation only allows masks between /25 and /32.
allocations.port_out_of_range: Ports in an allocation must be greater than 1024 and less than or equal to 65535.

nodes.configuration_not_persisted: The daemon configuration has been updated, however there was an error encountered when trying to update the daemon's config file. You will need to manually update the /var/lib/wisp/daemon/config/wisp.yaml file to reflect the new changes.

servers.title: Servers
servers.delete_server_notice: Are you sure that you want to delete the "{name}" server? Deleting a server is an irreversible action and will immediately remove this server from the panel and daemon.
servers.force_footer: Dangerous: Force deleting a server will remove the server from the panel even if the daemon reports an error. This may leave dangling files on your daemon if it reports an error.
servers.cant_delete_unmigrated_nodes_server: You can't delete a server on a node which has no configured FQDN - use force delete to proceed.

new.node_footer: The node which this server will be deployed to.
new.primary_allocation_footer: The main allocation that will be assigned to this server.
new.secondary_allocations_footer: Additional allocations to assign to this server on creation.
new.database_limit_footer: The total number of databases a user is allowed to create for this server. Leave blank to allow unlimited.
new.allocation_limit_footer: The total number of allocations a user is allowed to create for this server. Leave blank to allow unlimited.
new.backup_megabytes_limit_footer: The total number of megabytes the server can use for its backups.
new.cpu_footer: If you do not want to limit CPU usage, set the value to 0. To determine a value, take the number of physical cores and multiply it by 100. For example, on a quad core system (4 * 100 = 400) there is 400% available. To limit a server to using half of a single core, you would set the value to 50. To allow a server to use up to two physical cores, set the value to 200.
new.memory_footer: Memory limit in MB. If you want to disable memory limiting on a server, simply enter 0 into the memory field.
new.swap_footer: Swap space limit in MB. If you want to disable swap space on a server, simply enter 0 into the swap field.
new.disk_footer: Disk space limit in MB. If you want to disable disk space limiting on a server, simply enter 0 into the disk field.
new.io_footer: Block IO should be set to a value between 10-1000.
new.skip_scripts_footer: If the selected Egg has an install script attached to it, the script will run during install. If you would like to skip this step, check this box.

build_configuration.oom_disabled_footer: Disables the OOM Killer on the server. This will allow the server to float at the maximum ram and swap space.

databases.notice: Database passwords can be viewed when visiting this server on the front-end.

advanced.reinstall_server_note:
This will reinstall the server with the assigned service script.
Danger! This could overwrite data.
advanced.reinstall_started: The reinstall process has been started.
advanced.install_status_note: If you need to change the install status from uninstalled to installed, or vice versa, you may do so with the button below.
advanced.install_toggled: The install status has been toggled.
advanced.rebuild_container_note: This will trigger a rebuild of the server container when it next starts up. This is useful if you modified the server configuration file manually, or something just didn't work out correctly.
advanced.rebuild_requested: Rebuild request has been sent to the daemon, and the server will rebuild itself on the next start.
advanced.suspend_server_note: This will suspend the server, stop any running processes, and immediately block the user from being able to access their files or otherwise manage the server through the panel or API.
advanced.suspend_toggled: The suspension status has been toggled.
advanced.updating_status_note: If you need to change the updating status, you may do so with the button below.
advanced.updating_toggled: The update status has been toggled.
advanced.moving_status_note: If you need to change the moving status, you may do so with the button below.
advanced.moving_toggled: The move status has been toggled.
advanced.reset_mod_statuses_note: Will reset all mods' installation state if it bugs out, in case the server has mod installations locked completely and they have been stuck for a long time.
advanced.reset_mod_triggered: All server mod installation statuses have been reset.
advanced.install_marked_as_failed: Can't toggle server's install status due to it failing to install. Please reinstall the server instead.

deployment.no_viable_nodes: No nodes satisfying the requirements specified for automatic deployment could be found.
deployment.no_viable_allocations: No allocations satisfying the requirements for automatic deployment were found.

users.title: Users
users.external_id_footer: Leave empty to not assign an external identifier for this user. The external ID should be unique to this user and not be in use by any other users.
users.2fa_enabled_footer: This requires the user to have 2FA already setup, or otherwise they will not be able to login into their account.
users.password_optional: Providing a user password is optional. New user gets an email prompting them to create a password for their account. If a password is provided here you will need to find a different method of providing it to the user.
users.root_admin_footer: Setting this gives a user full administrative access.
users.support_op_footer: Setting this gives a user restricted administrative access for acting as a support agent.
users.support_op_bypass_footer: Setting this will bypass users having to give explicit permission to access their servers through the Support tab.
users.ignore_exceptions: Ignore exceptions raised while revoking keys.
users.ignore_exceptions_footer: If checked, any errors thrown while revoking keys across nodes will be ignored. You should avoid this checkbox if possible as any non-revoked keys could continue to be active for up to 24 hours after this account is changed. If you are needing to revoke account permissions immediately and are facing node issues, you should check this box and then restart any nodes that failed to be updated to clear out any stored keys.
users.user_has_no_2fa_configured: The user has no 2FA configured to be able to use it.
users.delete_notice: Are you sure that you want to delete the "{email}" user? There is no going back, all data will immediately be removed.
users.cant_delete_user_with_servers: You cannot delete a user while they own servers.

nests.title: Nests
nests.delete_notice: Are you sure that you want to delete the "{name}" nest? There is no going back, all data will immediately be removed.
nests.id_footer: A unique ID used for identification of this nest internally and through the API.
nests.uuid_footer: A UUID that all servers using this option are assigned for identification purposes.
nests.name_footer: This should be a descriptive category name that encompasses all of the eggs within the nest.
nests.identifier_footer: Short ID that can enable specific features (working ids: srcds, minecraft).
nests.nest_has_servers: You can not delete a nest which has servers running under it.

egg.daemon_restart_required_after_changes: Any changes to existing egg configuration currently requires to restart the daemons afterwards with `wisp restart`.
egg.delete_notice: Are you sure that you want to delete the "{name}" egg? There is no going back, all data will immediately be removed.
egg.egg_has_servers: You can not delete a egg which has servers running under it.
egg.egg_is_a_parent: This egg is a parent to one or more other eggs. Please delete those eggs before deleting this egg.
egg.must_be_a_child: The "Copy Settings From" directive for this egg must be a child option for the selected nest.
egg.copy_alert: All fields are required unless you select a separate option from the 'Copy Settings From' dropdown, in which case fields may be left blank to use the values from that option.
egg.invalid_copy: The egg selected for copying a script from either does not exist, or is copying a script from itself.
egg.import_update_notice: Importing a new egg file will overwrite any existing settings. If you wish to keep your existing settings, you should import the new egg separately.
egg.import_json_error: There was an error while attempting to parse the JSON file: {error}
egg.import_file_error: The JSON file provided was not valid.
egg.import_invalid_json: The JSON file provided is not in a format that can be recognized.

variables.variable_created: The startup variable has been successfully created.
variables.variable_updated: The "{name}" startup variable has been successfully updated.
variables.variable_deleted: The "{name}" startup variable has been successfully deleted.
variables.env_variable_reserved: The {name} environment variable is a reserved variable name.
variables.env_not_unique: The {name} environment variable is not unique.
variables.bad_validation_rule: The validation rule "{rule}" is not a valid rule.

mods.title: Mods
mods.delete_notice: Are you sure that you want to delete the "{name}" mod? There is no going back, all data will immediately be removed.
mods.mod_has_servers: Cannot modify the associated egg ID when servers are currently attached to a mod.
